issue.title: Explain 403 Forbidden error
issue.body:
Hi,

Does it possible to get more detail on possible cause of 403 - Forbidden error ? Using OnStarJS 2.3.11.

All commands (diag, status, etc) work except Start, I always get the following error :

UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: Request Failed with status 403 - Forbidden


Any idea on how to trobleshoot this issue ?

comment.body: @samrum Hi Ruben - sent you an email for further debugging.

Any idea on how to trobleshoot this issue ?

comment.body:
According to code it is "allow" or `null`. 
Not sure if `null` means no header, or it means actually null.

issue.title: Explain 403 Forbidden error
issue.body:
Hi,

Does it possible to get more detail on possible cause of 403 - Forbidden error ? Using OnStarJS 2.3.11.

All commands (diag, status, etc) work except Start, I always get the following error :

UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: Request Failed with status 403 - Forbidden


Any idea on how to trobleshoot this issue ?

comment.body:
Hi @samrum - Just to help with this issue to show some appreciation for your efforts <3

I made a quick script for you to easily get the keys from the APK: https://gist.github.com/coelho/911bab2d2416ef46e6f1aa09dcf97b43

All you have to do:

1. Unzip the APK `unzip <apkname>.apk`
2. Run with `java -jar OnstarAES.jar /path/to/apkunzip/res/raw/`
3. Done!

That doesn't really get me much closer to finding the issue (the keys match), but hey. It helps for next time.

issue.title: fix: use html/template for SAML POST/Logout templates
issue.body:
Follow up to #29 - Looks like the previous patch was incomplete.

Currently `text/template` is used, which does not properly HTML Encode the HTML Form values used in SAML POST/Logout flows.
Switching to `html/template` resolves this issue.

comment.body:
Added https://github.com/zitadel/saml/pull/32/commits/0c5648cb53ca62caccb3f2b8795339bf73626c1b

Confirmed with these patches:

- Login is working perfect with Google third-party SAML login.
- Logout still seems buggy (infinite redirect loop), but this is not a regression. It does not work in prior versions either.

Let me know if you have any questions.

commits.message: fix: xml html header breaks in post/logoutTemplate when using html/template

pull_request.title: fix: use html/template for SAML POST/Logout templates
pull_request.body:
Follow up to #29 - Looks like the previous patch was incomplete.

Currently `text/template` is used, which does not properly HTML Encode the HTML Form values used in SAML POST/Logout flows.
Switching to `html/template` resolves this issue.

issue.title: MagicDNS without DNS nameservers
issue.body:
**Feature request**

The [MagicDNS documentation](https://tailscale.com/kb/1081/magicdns) over at Tailscale says this:

> MagicDNS does not requires a [DNS nameserver](https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns/#using-dns-settings-in-the-admin-console) if running Tailscale v1.20 or later. Otherwise, your network must have at least one DNS nameserver set in the [admin console][admin]. These nameservers will receive all DNS queries not handled by MagicDNS.

I wonder if this can be applied to Headscale too, since some computers are behind DNS sinkholes (Pi-Hole) and providing a nameserver defies the purpose of setting up those sinkholes for normal browsing.

comment.body: Relevant #822

issue.title: Resubmit "Fix uncaught DNS_ERROR on failed connection to replicas"

labels.name: pr-bugfix
labels.description: Pull request with bugfix, not backported by default

issue.body:
Reverts ClickHouse/ClickHouse#41252 that reverted ClickHouse/ClickHouse#40881 Bugfix
Resubmitted at request of [tavplubix](https://github.com/tavplubix)

This bug breaks Distributed HA in the case of DNS errors. I believe the revert was a mistake & we should make sure this is in 22.9.

Causes a test `host_is_drop_from_cache_after_consecutive_failures ` https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/issues/41250 to be flaky.
- Logs: https://s3.amazonaws.com/clickhouse-test-reports/0/8587fa59f7c1a8d046395d40e01a404b2bffeac1/integration_tests__tsan__[3/4]/integration_run_test_dns_cache_test_py_0.log
- I believe this does not affect actual functionality and is just a testing error.

_Original description:_

DNS_ERROR would cause the replica to not be marked as unusable, resulting in the replica being repeatedly reattempted on subsequent queries and for connection failover to not function.
(This is common in Kubernetes setups where a replica has failed and it's DNS record is returning NXDOMAIN)

On SELECT of a Distributed table, would additionally result in an intermittent query error if the failed replica is chosen:
`Code: 198. DB::Exception: Received from localhost:9000. DB::Exception: Not found address of host: chi-clickhouse-main-2-0: While executing Remote. (DNS_ERROR)`

<!---
A technical comment, you are free to remove or leave it as it is when PR is created
The following categories are used in the next scripts, update them accordingly
utils/changelog/changelog.py
tests/ci/run_check.py
-->
### Changelog category (leave one):
- Bug Fix (user-visible misbehavior in official stable or prestable release)


### Changelog entry (a user-readable short description of the changes that goes to CHANGELOG.md):
Fix uncaught DNS_ERROR on failed connection to replicas.

comment.body:
@tavplubix Any news on this? The bug this patch fixes still exists in `HEAD`.

For context: Due to this bug, if we restart any Clickhouse Server in our Kube Cluster, the DNS record disappears, and every Distributed table in our cluster starts throwing query errors `DNS_ERROR` (even with an alive replica)

pull_request.title: fix duplicate URL Encode on RelayState
pull_request.body:
The RelayState is URL Encoded twice when using `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST`. 
- This is because Form Data is by default already URL Encoded.
- Additionally, for `HTTP-Redirect`, the RelayState is already Query Escaped: https://github.com/zitadel/saml/blob/main/pkg/provider/redirect.go#L120

This bug results in the ACS receiving the incorrect RelayState. This PR fixes the issue.

issue.title: Support Split DNS
issue.body:
**Feature request**

Split DNS is unsupported currently by Headscale. However, it can easily be supported!

It looks like `dnsConfig.Resolvers` decides whether or not the client overrides its Local DNS resolvers. If you comment out this line, Split DNS works perfectly:
https://github.com/juanfont/headscale/blob/main/config.go#L400

Would like feedback on how you would prefer this is implemented:
- `dns_config.override_dns (default: true)` configuration flag (sets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.split_dns (default: false)` configuration flag (unsets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.resolvers (default: alias to dns_config.nameservers)` configuration flag. 
  - Users can apply `dns_config.resolvers: []` to enable Split DNS.

Can submit a PR if you'd like based on feedback :) Thanks!

comment.body: @madjam002 Yes, but the operator should still have the option to not override at all if Split DNS is incompatible. That would be my preference.

comment.body:
@JulienMalka I'd say this is more of a UI issue with certain "third party servers" to be resolved there.
They could the Web UI be a good "how-to" for each platform & a convenient link to the MDM profile. This would solve your concern as well :)

comment.body:
> ... while we (the self-hosted community) want the option to be accessible without complicated machinery like MDMs.

This sounds like a good idea in addition to. 

- In my opinion though, MDM profiles are *really* easy to install on iOS. Few clicks and you're done.
- In your case, you would need to type the URL into the settings box, and know where it is. 

Both options need how-tos in your employee handbook, and I think clicking is easier.

issue.title: Support Split DNS
issue.body:
**Feature request**

Split DNS is unsupported currently by Headscale. However, it can easily be supported!

It looks like `dnsConfig.Resolvers` decides whether or not the client overrides its Local DNS resolvers. If you comment out this line, Split DNS works perfectly:
https://github.com/juanfont/headscale/blob/main/config.go#L400

Would like feedback on how you would prefer this is implemented:
-`dns_config.override_dns (default: true)` configuration flag (sets "Resolvers" if "true")
-`dns_config.split_dns (default: false)` configuration flag (unsets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.resolvers: (default: dns_config.nameservers)` configuration flag. Users can do `dns_config.resolvers: []` to enable Split DNS.

Can submit a PR if you'd like based on feedback :) Thanks!

issue.title: Flat Role Claim(s)
issue.body:
## Description

While taking with @rollicks-c around how to use ZITADEL's role model with the oauth2-proxy project the question came up if it is feasible to reuse the existing groups claim. Currently we provide the claim as json which breaks the groups claim parsing because it awaits as list of strings.

A possible solution to this that I already did discuss with @livio-a is to allow customers to request the claim in a flattened manor. For example `["{orgId}:{role}", "{orgId}:{role}"]`

**Acceptance criteria**
- [ ] Discus if a "single project" scope/claim also would make sense (e.g only requesting the users roles for a defined org, either the clients or the users)
- [ ] Design & Implement Scope
- [ ] Design & Implement Claim
- [ ] Update docs
- [ ] Update oauth2-proxy QuickStart

My 2 cents is that we should do this in order to encourage more people to convert from keycloak. Is see more cases there as well. For example ArgoCD also could accept it in that way.

comment.body: Is there a work-around for this issue when using OAuth2 Proxy? From what I see there is no current work-around.

issue.title: Regex error in Safari: "Invalid regular expression: invalid group specifier name"
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to use the plugin in Safari results in the error:
`Invalid regular expression: invalid group specifier name Instantiating https://.../public/plugins/grafana-clickhouse-datasource/module.js Loading plugins/grafana-clickhouse-datasource/module`

**Versions**
Grafana 9.1.2
Safari 15.6
Datasource 2.0.0

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open in Safari

**Expected behavior**
There should be no error.

**Screenshots**
![Image](https://coelho.ninja/sHISVFHIgSFGUJySTb+9CIbgfIc=)

**Additional context**
According to a quick Google, likely related to Safari not supporting Regex look-behind?
https://caniuse.com/js-regexp-lookbehind

comment.body:
Hi @bossinc If it's not too much trouble, can a new version be pushed to https://grafana.com/grafana/plugins/grafana-clickhouse-datasource/ with the fixed version?
Thank you!

issue.title: Best sharding_key for Distributed tables?
issue.body:
I'm doing some experimentation with replication and sharding and still trying to learn more about the internals of qryn.  I don't have any concrete results yet but I started reading some of the CH docs and reviewed the suggested schema for distributed tables: 

https://github.com/metrico/qryn/wiki/sharding-replication
https://github.com/metrico/qryn/issues/172

I'm wondering if using `rand()` for the sharding key of the `samples_v3` table might be better based on the following:

* High volume logs with identical label sets can unbalance the cluster since they all end up on a single shard.
* Using a field for sharding can improve performance if you do a lot of JOINs on that field, however I think this might be negated by the fact that you currently have to set `distributed_product_mode` to `global`.

This makes me start wondering if it would be necessary to make qryn itself aware of the sharding key to optimize queries but still need to experiment more.

Also, it might be good to add some notes to the wiki link about about potentially needing to customize the schema to use `ON CLUSTER` and I think some of the CH macros that it uses are custom to the Altinity K8s clickhouse-operator but I might be mistaken.

comment.body:
I chose `fingerprint` as the sharding key to optimize compression. In regards to query performance, I believe it's negligible given an average query's cardinality.

I think the main concern is unbalanced shards, and I'd say that again really depends on your cardinality. Dependent on your use case (for ex. logging), your cardinality may be pretty high so it may be a non-issue. With that said, this might be something to optimize at scale dependent on your workload.

> CH macros that it uses are custom to the Altinity K8s clickhouse-operator 

Right :) They are currently Altinity K8 macros. Of course they can be adjusted to whatever.

issue.title: How to configure cluster to have 1 write-only + 2 read-only replicas?
issue.body:
### Background
I'm beginning work to set up a ClickHouse cluster with 3 CH nodes. The first node (Node A) would be write-only, and the remaining 2 (Nodes B + C) would be read-only. By this I mean that writes for a given table to Node A would automatically replicate to Nodes B + C. When querying the cluster, reads would only be resolved against Nodes B + C.

I'm also unclear whether I should be using ClickHouse Keeper or Zookeeper. Based on a brief conversation I had with Altinity, I'm under the impression that ZooKeeper is more stable/battle-tested and I should use this. Any guidance here is also appreciated.

### Question
I'm not finding much specific information in the CH documentation, and am wondering whether this might be possible. If so, what would the cluster configuration look like?

@tavplubix Any news on this? The bug this patch fixes still exists in `HEAD`.

For context: Due to this bug, if we restart any Clickhouse Server in our Kube Cluster, the DNS record disappears, and every Distributed table in our cluster starts throwing query errors `DNS_ERROR` (even with an alive replica)

pull_request.title: fix duplicate URL Encode on RelayState
pull_request.body:
The RelayState is URL Encoded twice when using `urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:bindings:HTTP-POST`. 
- This is because Form Data is by default already URL Encoded.
- Additionally, for `HTTP-Redirect`, the RelayState is already Query Escaped: https://github.com/zitadel/saml/blob/main/pkg/provider/redirect.go#L120

This bug results in the ACS receiving the incorrect RelayState. This PR fixes the issue.

issue.title: Support Split DNS
issue.body:
**Feature request**

Split DNS is unsupported currently by Headscale. However, it can easily be supported!

It looks like `dnsConfig.Resolvers` decides whether or not the client overrides its Local DNS resolvers. If you comment out this line, Split DNS works perfectly:
https://github.com/juanfont/headscale/blob/main/config.go#L400

Would like feedback on how you would prefer this is implemented:
- `dns_config.override_dns (default: true)` configuration flag (sets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.split_dns (default: false)` configuration flag (unsets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.resolvers (default: alias to dns_config.nameservers)` configuration flag. 
  - Users can apply `dns_config.resolvers: []` to enable Split DNS.

Can submit a PR if you'd like based on feedback :) Thanks!

comment.body: @madjam002 Yes, but the operator should still have the option to not override at all if Split DNS is incompatible. That would be my preference.

issue.title: Support Split DNS
issue.body:
**Feature request**

Split DNS is unsupported currently by Headscale. However, it can easily be supported!

It looks like `dnsConfig.Resolvers` decides whether or not the client overrides its Local DNS resolvers. If you comment out this line, Split DNS works perfectly:
https://github.com/juanfont/headscale/blob/main/config.go#L400

Would like feedback on how you would prefer this is implemented:
-`dns_config.override_dns (default: true)` configuration flag (sets "Resolvers" if "true")
-`dns_config.split_dns (default: false)` configuration flag (unsets "Resolvers" if "true")
- `dns_config.resolvers: (default: dns_config.nameservers)` configuration flag. Users can do `dns_config.resolvers: []` to enable Split DNS.

Can submit a PR if you'd like based on feedback :) Thanks!

issue.title: Flat Role Claim(s)
issue.body:
## Description

While taking with @rollicks-c around how to use ZITADEL's role model with the oauth2-proxy project the question came up if it is feasible to reuse the existing groups claim. Currently we provide the claim as json which breaks the groups claim parsing because it awaits as list of strings.

A possible solution to this that I already did discuss with @livio-a is to allow customers to request the claim in a flattened manor. For example `["{orgId}:{role}", "{orgId}:{role}"]`

**Acceptance criteria**
- [ ] Discus if a "single project" scope/claim also would make sense (e.g only requesting the users roles for a defined org, either the clients or the users)
- [ ] Design & Implement Scope
- [ ] Design & Implement Claim
- [ ] Update docs
- [ ] Update oauth2-proxy QuickStart

My 2 cents is that we should do this in order to encourage more people to convert from keycloak. Is see more cases there as well. For example ArgoCD also could accept it in that way.

comment.body: Is there a work-around for this issue when using OAuth2 Proxy? From what I see there is no current work-around.

pull_request.title: Revert "Revert "Fix uncaught DNS_ERROR on failed connection to replicas""
pull_request.body:
Reverts ClickHouse/ClickHouse#41252 that reverted ClickHouse/ClickHouse#40881 Bugfix
Resubmitted at request of [tavplubix](https://github.com/tavplubix)

This bug breaks Distributed HA in the case of DNS errors. I believe the revert was a mistake & we should make sure this is in 22.10.

Causes a test `host_is_drop_from_cache_after_consecutive_failures ` https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/issues/41250 to be flaky.
- Logs: https://s3.amazonaws.com/clickhouse-test-reports/0/8587fa59f7c1a8d046395d40e01a404b2bffeac1/integration_tests__tsan__[3/4]/integration_run_test_dns_cache_test_py_0.log
- I believe this does not affect actual functionality and is just a testing error.

_Original description:_

DNS_ERROR would cause the replica to not be marked as unusable, resulting in the replica being repeatedly reattempted on subsequent queries and for connection failover to not function.
(This is common in Kubernetes setups where a replica has failed and it's DNS record is returning NXDOMAIN)

On SELECT of a Distributed table, would additionally result in an intermittent query error if the failed replica is chosen:
`Code: 198. DB::Exception: Received from localhost:9000. DB::Exception: Not found address of host: chi-clickhouse-main-2-0: While executing Remote. (DNS_ERROR)`

<!---
A technical comment, you are free to remove or leave it as it is when PR is created
The following categories are used in the next scripts, update them accordingly
utils/changelog/changelog.py
tests/ci/run_check.py
-->
### Changelog category (leave one):
- Bug Fix (user-visible misbehavior in official stable or prestable release)


### Changelog entry (a user-readable short description of the changes that goes to CHANGELOG.md):
Fix uncaught DNS_ERROR on failed connection to replicas.

issue.title: Regex error in Safari: "Invalid regular expression: invalid group specifier name"
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to use the plugin in Safari results in the error:
`Invalid regular expression: invalid group specifier name Instantiating https://.../public/plugins/grafana-clickhouse-datasource/module.js Loading plugins/grafana-clickhouse-datasource/module`

**Versions**
Grafana 9.1.2
Safari 15.6
Datasource 2.0.0

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open in Safari

**Expected behavior**
There should be no error.

**Screenshots**
![Image](https://coelho.ninja/sHISVFHIgSFGUJySTb+9CIbgfIc=)

**Additional context**
According to a quick Google, likely related to Safari not supporting Regex look-behind?
https://caniuse.com/js-regexp-lookbehind

comment.body:
Hi @bossinc If it's not too much trouble, can a new version be pushed to https://grafana.com/grafana/plugins/grafana-clickhouse-datasource/ with the fixed version?
Thank you!

issue.title: Best sharding_key for Distributed tables?
issue.body:
I'm doing some experimentation with replication and sharding and still trying to learn more about the internals of qryn.  I don't have any concrete results yet but I started reading some of the CH docs and reviewed the suggested schema for distributed tables: 

https://github.com/metrico/qryn/wiki/sharding-replication
https://github.com/metrico/qryn/issues/172

I'm wondering if using `rand()` for the sharding key of the `samples_v3` table might be better based on the following:

* High volume logs with identical label sets can unbalance the cluster since they all end up on a single shard.
* Using a field for sharding can improve performance if you do a lot of JOINs on that field, however I think this might be negated by the fact that you currently have to set `distributed_product_mode` to `global`.

This makes me start wondering if it would be necessary to make qryn itself aware of the sharding key to optimize queries but still need to experiment more.

Also, it might be good to add some notes to the wiki link about about potentially needing to customize the schema to use `ON CLUSTER` and I think some of the CH macros that it uses are custom to the Altinity K8s clickhouse-operator but I might be mistaken.

comment.body:
I chose `fingerprint` as the sharding key to optimize compression. In regards to query performance, I believe it's negligible given an average query's cardinality.

I think the main concern is unbalanced shards, and I'd say that again really depends on your cardinality. Dependent on your use case (for ex. logging), your cardinality may be pretty high so it may be a non-issue. With that said, this might be something to optimize at scale dependent on your workload.

> CH macros that it uses are custom to the Altinity K8s clickhouse-operator 

Right :) They are currently Altinity K8 macros. Of course they can be adjusted to whatever.

issue.title: How to configure cluster to have 1 write-only + 2 read-only replicas?
issue.body:
### Background
I'm beginning work to set up a ClickHouse cluster with 3 CH nodes. The first node (Node A) would be write-only, and the remaining 2 (Nodes B + C) would be read-only. By this I mean that writes for a given table to Node A would automatically replicate to Nodes B + C. When querying the cluster, reads would only be resolved against Nodes B + C.

I'm also unclear whether I should be using ClickHouse Keeper or Zookeeper. Based on a brief conversation I had with Altinity, I'm under the impression that ZooKeeper is more stable/battle-tested and I should use this. Any guidance here is also appreciated.

### Question
I'm not finding much specific information in the CH documentation, and am wondering whether this might be possible. If so, what would the cluster configuration look like?

issue.title: Explain 403 Forbidden error
issue.body:
Hi,

Does it possible to get more detail on possible cause of 403 - Forbidden error ? Using OnStarJS 2.3.11.

All commands (diag, status, etc) work except Start, I always get the following error :

UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: Request Failed with status 403 - Forbidden


Any idea on how to trobleshoot this issue ?

comment.body: @samrum Hi Ruben - sent you an email for further debugging.

issue.title: Explain 403 Forbidden error
issue.body:
Hi,

Does it possible to get more detail on possible cause of 403 - Forbidden error ? Using OnStarJS 2.3.11.

All commands (diag, status, etc) work except Start, I always get the following error :

UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: Request Failed with status 403 - Forbidden


Any idea on how to trobleshoot this issue ?

comment.body:
According to code it is "allow" or `null`. 
Not sure if `null` means no header, or it means actually null.

issue.title: Explain 403 Forbidden error
issue.body:
Hi,

Does it possible to get more detail on possible cause of 403 - Forbidden error ? Using OnStarJS 2.3.11.

All commands (diag, status, etc) work except Start, I always get the following error :

UnhandledPromiseRejectionWarning: Error: Request Failed with status 403 - Forbidden


Any idea on how to trobleshoot this issue ?

comment.body:
Hi @samrum - Just to help with this issue to show some appreciation for your efforts <3

I made a quick script for you to easily get the keys from the APK: https://gist.github.com/coelho/911bab2d2416ef46e6f1aa09dcf97b43

All you have to do:

1. Unzip the APK `unzip <apkname>.apk`
2. Run with `java -jar OnstarAES.jar /path/to/apkunzip/res/raw/`
3. Done!

That doesn't really get me much closer to finding the issue (the keys match), but hey. It helps for next time.

issue.title: fix: use html/template for SAML POST/Logout templates
issue.body:
Follow up to #29 - Looks like the previous patch was incomplete.

Currently `text/template` is used, which does not properly HTML Encode the HTML Form values used in SAML POST/Logout flows.
Switching to `html/template` resolves this issue.

comment.body:
Added https://github.com/zitadel/saml/pull/32/commits/0c5648cb53ca62caccb3f2b8795339bf73626c1b

Confirmed with these patches:

- Login is working perfect with Google third-party SAML login.
- Logout still seems buggy (infinite redirect loop), but this is not a regression. It does not work in prior versions either.

Let me know if you have any questions.

commits.message: fix: xml html header breaks in post/logoutTemplate when using html/template

pull_request.title: fix: use html/template for SAML POST/Logout templates
pull_request.body:
Follow up to #29 - Looks like the previous patch was incomplete.

Currently `text/template` is used, which does not properly HTML Encode the HTML Form values used in SAML POST/Logout flows.
Switching to `html/template` resolves this issue.

issue.title: MagicDNS without DNS nameservers
issue.body:
**Feature request**

The [MagicDNS documentation](https://tailscale.com/kb/1081/magicdns) over at Tailscale says this:

> MagicDNS does not requires a [DNS nameserver](https://tailscale.com/kb/1054/dns/#using-dns-settings-in-the-admin-console) if running Tailscale v1.20 or later. Otherwise, your network must have at least one DNS nameserver set in the [admin console][admin]. These nameservers will receive all DNS queries not handled by MagicDNS.

I wonder if this can be applied to Headscale too, since some computers are behind DNS sinkholes (Pi-Hole) and providing a nameserver defies the purpose of setting up those sinkholes for normal browsing.

comment.body: Relevant #822

This bug breaks Distributed HA in the case of DNS errors. I believe the revert was a mistake & we should make sure this is in 22.10.

Causes a test `host_is_drop_from_cache_after_consecutive_failures ` https://github.com/ClickHouse/ClickHouse/issues/41250 to be flaky.
- Logs: https://s3.amazonaws.com/clickhouse-test-reports/0/8587fa59f7c1a8d046395d40e01a404b2bffeac1/integration_tests__tsan__[3/4]/integration_run_test_dns_cache_test_py_0.log
- I believe this does not affect actual functionality and is just a testing error.

_Original description:_

DNS_ERROR would cause the replica to not be marked as unusable, resulting in the replica being repeatedly reattempted on subsequent queries and for connection failover to not function.
(This is common in Kubernetes setups where a replica has failed and it's DNS record is returning NXDOMAIN)

On SELECT of a Distributed table, would additionally result in an intermittent query error if the failed replica is chosen:
`Code: 198. DB::Exception: Received from localhost:9000. DB::Exception: Not found address of host: chi-clickhouse-main-2-0: While executing Remote. (DNS_ERROR)`

<!---
A technical comment, you are free to remove or leave it as it is when PR is created
The following categories are used in the next scripts, update them accordingly
utils/changelog/changelog.py
tests/ci/run_check.py
-->
### Changelog category (leave one):
- Bug Fix (user-visible misbehavior in official stable or prestable release)


### Changelog entry (a user-readable short description of the changes that goes to CHANGELOG.md):
Fix uncaught DNS_ERROR on failed connection to replicas.

issue.title: Regex error in Safari: "Invalid regular expression: invalid group specifier name"
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to use the plugin in Safari results in the error:
`Invalid regular expression: invalid group specifier name Instantiating https://.../public/plugins/grafana-clickhouse-datasource/module.js Loading plugins/grafana-clickhouse-datasource/module`

**Versions**
Grafana 9.1.2
Safari 15.6
Datasource 2.0.0

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open in Safari

**Expected behavior**
There should be no error.

**Screenshots**
![Image](https://coelho.ninja/sHISVFHIgSFGUJySTb+9CIbgfIc=)

**Additional context**
According to a quick Google, likely related to Safari not supporting Regex look-behind?
https://caniuse.com/js-regexp-lookbehind

comment.body:
Hi @bossinc If it's not too much trouble, can a new version be pushed to https://grafana.com/grafana/plugins/grafana-clickhouse-datasource/ with the fixed version?
Thank you!

issue.title: Best sharding_key for Distributed tables?
issue.body:
I'm doing some experimentation with replication and sharding and still trying to learn more about the internals of qryn.  I don't have any concrete results yet but I started reading some of the CH docs and reviewed the suggested schema for distributed tables: 

https://github.com/metrico/qryn/wiki/sharding-replication
https://github.com/metrico/qryn/issues/172

I'm wondering if using `rand()` for the sharding key of the `samples_v3` table might be better based on the following:

* High volume logs with identical label sets can unbalance the cluster since they all end up on a single shard.
* Using a field for sharding can improve performance if you do a lot of JOINs on that field, however I think this might be negated by the fact that you currently have to set `distributed_product_mode` to `global`.

This makes me start wondering if it would be necessary to make qryn itself aware of the sharding key to optimize queries but still need to experiment more.

Also, it might be good to add some notes to the wiki link about about potentially needing to customize the schema to use `ON CLUSTER` and I think some of the CH macros that it uses are custom to the Altinity K8s clickhouse-operator but I might be mistaken.

comment.body:
I chose `fingerprint` as the sharding key to optimize compression. In regards to query performance, I believe it's negligible given an average query's cardinality.

I think the main concern is unbalanced shards, and I'd say that again really depends on your cardinality. Dependent on your use case (for ex. logging), your cardinality may be pretty high so it may be a non-issue. With that said, this might be something to optimize at scale dependent on your workload.

> CH macros that it uses are custom to the Altinity K8s clickhouse-operator 

Right :) They are currently Altinity K8 macros. Of course they can be adjusted to whatever.

issue.title: How to configure cluster to have 1 write-only + 2 read-only replicas?
issue.body:
### Background
I'm beginning work to set up a ClickHouse cluster with 3 CH nodes. The first node (Node A) would be write-only, and the remaining 2 (Nodes B + C) would be read-only. By this I mean that writes for a given table to Node A would automatically replicate to Nodes B + C. When querying the cluster, reads would only be resolved against Nodes B + C.

I'm also unclear whether I should be using ClickHouse Keeper or Zookeeper. Based on a brief conversation I had with Altinity, I'm under the impression that ZooKeeper is more stable/battle-tested and I should use this. Any guidance here is also appreciated.

### Question
I'm not finding much specific information in the CH documentation, and am wondering whether this might be possible. If so, what would the cluster configuration look like?
